title: CourtVision
description: Building an automated scouting system for the UCSD D1 men's basketball team to analyze basketball offensive sets run by opposing teams to minimize manual video review. The system will consist of computer vision and pattern recognition/classification modules, as well as an interactive dashboard that visualizes insights generated by those modules.

title: Paper Petals
description: A React application built for a local creative mind, showcasing their collection of handmade origami flowers.
comments: Designed using Figma, built with React / TypeScript.

title: Portfolio v1
description: The website you are currently on! Built to showcase my projects and my playground for frontend development. Designed to also be compatible on mobile devices! (I hope)

title: Stage Left: Typing with Parkinson's
description: My team's final project for DSC 106: Data Visualization, where we set off to tell a story about the effects of Parkinson's Disease using interactive visualizations! I created two interactive games, one where the user races against a simulation modeled with Parkinson's, and one where the user is digitally constrained to typing at the same speed as the modeled simulation with Parkinson's.

title: Classifying Benign and Malignant Tumors
description: From January to June 2025, I led a group of two researchers to investigate the best architecture of model to use to classify breast tumor micrographs. I built my own U-Net architecture model and quantitatively compared it to a Vision Transformer, built from scratch using PyTorch, and ResNet18, a pretrained model we knew would do well.

title: Bikewatching in Boston
description: For DSC 106: Data Visualization, I created a dynamic webpage that visualizes bike traffic in the city of Boston.

title: Recipe Representation
description: For DSC 80: Practice of Data Science, I researched if online recipe tags accurately described the recipe. I explored the data, analyzed distributions and hypotheses, and ultimately trained a random forest classifier to analyze the representation of a chosen tag.
